definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: Blinking lubricates the eye and rests it.
sentences.chinese: 眨眼睛能使眼睛溼潤而覺得舒適。

sentences.english: Afterwards, blink or squeeze your eyes shut to relax them.
sentences.chinese: 然後，眨眼睛或者眯起眼睛來放鬆眼球。
“它，它沒燃燒，”達多眨了眨眼睛。

sentences.english: She blinked (her eyes) as the bright light shone on her.
sentences.chinese: 強烈的光線射到她時她眨眼睛。

sentences.english: As methods of human communication go, a wink is quite versatile.
sentences.chinese: 作爲人類一種交流方式，眨眼睛有着很多複雜意思。

sentences.english: What you may have missed is the fact that they had stopped blinking.
sentences.chinese: 你或許忽略了一個事實，那就是他們不再眨眼睛。

sentences.english: Ziro blinked, passing the nictitating membranes across his eyes with slow deliberation.
sentences.chinese: 齊羅眨眨眼睛，讓瞬膜故意慢慢翻過眼球。

sentences.english: She blinked as the bright light shone on her.
sentences.chinese: 當強光照着她時，她便眨眼睛。

sentences.english: Do you notice they wink when the stars go across the sky?
sentences.chinese: 當星星劃過天空，你是否是屬意到它正在眨眼睛？

sentences.english: He blinked in the bright sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 他在強烈的陽光下直眨眼睛。

sentences.english: He was just kind of blinking.
sentences.chinese: 他只是一個勁的眨眼睛。

sentences.english: Her answer was gruff, but her eyes twinkled.
sentences.chinese: 她的回答很粗魯，但她眨了眨眼睛。

sentences.english: She blinked her eyes at the bright light.
sentences.chinese: 她對着明亮的燈光直眨眼睛。

sentences.english: Example: Father winked at Dick as a sign for him to keep still.
sentences.chinese: 父親向狄克眨眼睛，叫他不要動。

definition: like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
to blink/to wink/in the twinkling of an eye
to turn one's head/in no time/in the twinkling of an eye
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
to turn one's head/to turn around
